alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 10:35AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Hancock, Des Moines, Henderson and Lee Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jo Daviess, Dubuque and Jackson Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. .A recent period of well above normal temperatures melted the snowpack across Minnesota and Wisconsin which has led to increased runoff into the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.5 feet, Water affects the Illinois Central railroad tracks in Dubuque. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday afternoon and continue rising to 20.4 feet by next Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued by this evening.
